text:
Hello all. Does anyone know why I get this error? I googled it but no results. Maybe someone can give me an insight about this.
`[ERROR] folder_metadata limit 2000 reached for <portal_id>`
I should mention that I have quite a few projects in my sandbox. Does the sandbox have a limit for number of folders?
Thanks!
yeah there’s a limit of 2,000 folders which you’ve exceeded

Can anyone help me out with a hs cli installation issue? I have Node/NPM installed via homebrew, and using ZSH. I had this all working on a previous machine, but had to get a new Mac here at work. However, after hs install LOCALLY. ZSH cannot find the command. I want to install locally:

➜  git:(master) ✗ npm install @HubSpot/cli

up to date, audited 520 packages in 1s

19 packages are looking for funding
  run `npm fund` for details

found 0 vulnerabilities
➜  git:(master) ✗ hs --version
zsh: command not found: hs
looks like you’ve installed HubSpot cli locally, but trying to use a global version.
if you want to use it locally i imagine you’ll need to use npx
try using the `-g` flag to install globally

Thanks. I did try doing that, and had the same problem. I would prefer to install it locally as I only have one HubSpot dev project on my machine. I can see it in there. I just want the command to work : /Users/me/Sites/myproject/node_modules/.bin/hs
when installing local to a project, you’ll need to run via `npx hs` or you can run via `scripts` in package.json together with `npm run`.
I have mine installed globally, but have you tried running `npm hs --version` from this directory `/Users/me/Sites/myproject/`
